title: Lev Yashin
summary: Lev Ivanovich Yashin (Russian: Лев Ива́нович Я́шин; 22 October 1929 – 20 March 1990), nicknamed  the "Black Spider" or the "Black Panther",[2][3] was a Soviet professional footballer, regarded by many as the greatest goalkeeper in the history of the sport.[4] He was known for his athleticism, positioning, stature, bravery, imposing presence in goal, and acrobatic reflex saves.[5][6][7][8] He was also deputy chairman of the Football Federation of the Soviet Union.
